chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm did not Occur and Child Under 6 Years of age
Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J. Staves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm did not Occur and Child Under 6 Years of age, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy J. Staves

records.addlTxt:
Order Staying Jail Time
It is ordered: the defendant's remaining jail time is hereby ordered stayed as of 10/31/2022. The jail time will remain stayed pending good standing status in the Treatment Court and will be waived in the event the defendant continues with successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program requirements. The stayed jail time may be re-imposed for good cause.

Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court.
IT IS ORDERED: this case is transferred to Branch 5 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program.  The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice - Return to Sender, Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward

3:42 PM Cases called: 22CF947, 22CM588, 22CM757, 22CT45 & 22CT298. Defendant Billy J. Staves in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Billy J. Staves. Attorney Rachel Robole appeared. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF947: Neglecting a Child and Count 4 in 22CF947: Possession of Methamphetamine
Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CM588: Misd Retail Theft and Count 1 in 22CM757: Misd Retail Theft
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CT298: Operating While Revoked

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
on Count 1 in 22CM757: Misd Retail Theft and Count 1 in 22CT298: Operating While Revoked: court costs and surcharges and DNA sample. 
on Count 1 in 22CM588: Misd Retail Theft - court costs and surcharges, DNA sample and restitution in the amount of $280.87 with 10% surcharge.
on 22CF947 on each count concurrent: 3 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions
Conditions of Probation:
Participate in and successfully complete treatment court. If treatment court is not successfully completed, any remaining stayed jail time will need to be served. 
9 months jail with Huber or electronic monitoring if jail and treatment court team deems him eligible: last 8 months stayed pending further order of the court. Remaining 30 days to be served immediately - should treatment court team decide defendant should initially serve less than 30 days, the team will file a motion with the Court for the Court's consideration. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Comply with DHS conditions and requirements.
court costs.

64 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation. 
Any remaining counts in these cases and all of 22CT45 is ordered dismissed and read in.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:04 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Billy Staves appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler. ADA Matthew Kirkpatrick appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and updates the Defendant's address and phone number. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $2,500 cash bond- recites failures to appear. Defense requests signature bond or low cash bond. Court orders $500 cash bond with various conditions. 
Preliminary Hearing: 08/23/2022 at 2:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with X.S. without DHS permission.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
Comply with DHS requirements in regard to X.S.
